tweet: May is National #MilitaryAppreciationMonth. I commend all members of the U.S. military – both former and present – for their service and dedication to our nation. We are forever indebted to these brave heroes. https://t.co/LMPUCaHjxS

This week is #NursesWeek! I want to thank all of the dedicated nurses throughout #AL & across the nation – not only for their selfless efforts during the #COVID19 crisis, but also for their hard work & devotion to protecting & saving lives all the time.

Today @NOAA announced their plan to provide $300 million to assist the U.S. fishing industry in mitigating impacts caused by #COVID19. This includes $3.3M for #Alabama! I am proud to have fought to include this funding in the #CARESAct.

Today the Senate @BankingGOP Committee held a hearing to consider the nomination of Dana Wade to be @FHAgov commissioner. Her prior public service & extensive knowledge of housing issues make her well-suited for this position.

Happy #TeacherAppreciationWeek to all of AL's hardworking teachers. Proud of their efforts to invest in the lives & education of students – and especially grateful for their willingness to go above and beyond during #COVID19. Let’s take time this week to celebrate our #teachers.

Spoke with @SenateMajLdr today. I believe widespread #COVID19 testing is the key to safely reopening the entire US economy. That is how we get out of this dilemma; not by spending trillions & trillions more. We cannot continue to rack up nat’l debt without knowing what’s working.

Amidst this public health and economic crisis, we must remember and salute those who continue to serve our nation. Health care professionals, researchers, policeman, firefighters, truck drivers, grocery store clerks, and other members of society are still out there working hard.

Relief is finally coming to the American people! Tonight, the Senate passed legislation that will provide $2 trillion in funding to provide for those in need during this mounting emergency. Glad we have finally been able to advance these resources and help protect our people.

Proud we're finally closer to addressing this urgent matter. The #CARESAct contains $340B in emergency supplemental funding for those suffering due to this crisis. More than 80% of total funds in the #appropriations division will go directly to state & local govts & communities.

The American people need our help in the midst of this emergency. I urge my colleagues across the aisle to help us agree on a comprehensive package so we can provide critical resources for those in need during this time of unease throughout our nation. Time is of the essence.

During this unprecedented time, the Senate has been able to advance another agreement to help combat this deadly disease. Although my colleagues and I still have urgent work to do, this is a step in the right direction.

The Senate remains in session this week working to pass monumental legislation to combat the Coronavirus & help the American people. In the meantime, please visit my website for helpful information & resources related to COVID-19: https://t.co/w8nilIG10p

I urge everyone to be safe and practice the @CDCgov-recommended protocols. The Senate will continue to work next week on additional bipartisan legislation to combat the Coronavirus and protect our economy. Our top priority is the health and safety of the American people.

Pleased the Senate voted today to pass the #Coronavirus emergency supplemental package by a vote of 96-1, directing $8.3B in total resources to combat the virus at the local, state, federal, and international levels amidst this urgent crisis.

Today we came to an agreement on a $7.767B Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Package to combat the #Coronavirus. We worked together to craft an aggressive and comprehensive response that provides the resources the experts say they need to combat this crisis.

Delivering remarks shortly on the Senate floor regarding the $7.767 billion #Coronavirus Emergency Supplemental. Tune in! This shouldn't be about politics; this is about doing our job to protect the American people. I urge my colleagues to support the package without delay.

As a pro-life advocate, I voted today to advance the Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act and the Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act. These bills are an important step in defending innocent human lives.

From investing in AL's #infrastructure & supporting #agricultural development to funding groundbreaking medical research, the 1st FY20 appropriations measure addresses important priorities. Proud of this bipartisan agreement & look forward to its impact. https://t.co/rikHwK1BLC

The Senate passed H.R. 1865, an appropriations package including funds for critical domestic & int'l assistance priorities. Pleased that as a result of our bipartisan efforts, we were able to come to an agreement & send these bills to the President’s desk. https://t.co/MUi3hduZxc

Over the last 12 wks, House Dems engineered a political circus & distracted us from the important work we’re here to accomplish for the American ppl. Their impeachment effort was rushed, unfair, & careless – & their decision to impeach POTUS last night seems completely unfounded.

This week I joined a resolution with several of my colleagues honoring the victims of the tragic shooting at Naval Air Station Pensacola. The measure passed the Senate today. We'll never forget their service to our nation & the lives they saved by giving their own.

Another victory for Alabama! The FY20 Agriculture appropriations bill includes a provision to ensure disaster relief funds that are set to expire at the end of 2019 remain available to assist agricultural producers who have been affected by natural disasters in recent years.

Big win for AL’s fisheries! The FY20 CJS appropriations legislation contains $5 million to continue to delegate the management of #redsnapper to the Gulf States and $5 million to develop an independent estimate of the abundance of greater amberjack in the Gulf of Mexico.
Excellent news for @UofAlabama! This year’s CJS appropriations bill contains $34.5 million to support staffing & operations at @NOAA’s @NWSNWC there. Look forward to the impact these funds will have.

Big win: This year’s #THUD appropriations bill contains $30 million for Alabama’s Appalachian Development Highway System. Proud to have worked to secure this funding to improve AL’s highway #infrastructure.

#AL remains on the forefront of space exploration! The FY20 CJS appropriations measure contains $2.586 billion for @NASA_SLS, along with an additional $44.1 million for the lunar lander office at @NASA_Marshall to lead the support of @NASA’s accelerated exploration timeline.
Great news for @AuburnU! The FY20 Homeland Security appropriations legislation contains $15.3 million for its Explosive Detection Canine Program. Proud to have secured this important funding.

Major victory in this year’s Homeland Security appropriations bill! The measure contains $150 million that will support new @USCG helicopter hulls to be produced in #Troy. Looking forward to watching this project come to fruition.

.@UABnews Clinical & Translational Sciences Award program continues to thrive! The FY20 Labor-HHS appropriations bill contains over $578 million in funding for CTSA. Look forward to watching this program improve patient and community health.

Huge news for @NIH! The FY20 Labor-HHS appropriations bill contains $41.7 billion for #NIH to conduct cutting-edge medical research to find cures for deadly diseases. Excited to see the life-saving discoveries that will stem from this funding.

BIG NEWS: The Senate will soon vote on two FY2020 appropriations packages containing major victories for #Alabama and the nation. I am proud to have secured this important funding for a host of projects that will benefit our state. Here are a few things included in the bills:

News from the @WhiteHouse: @POTUS has announced his intent to nominate Anna Manasco of #Birmingham to serve as a District Judge for the Northern District of #AL. Anna is an impressive nominee, & I am confident that, if confirmed, she will work to uphold the rule of law.

Exciting news! Science & technology leader, @LeidosInc, just announced its decision to acquire #Huntsville’s @Dynetics. Look forward to the cutting-edge national security & defense work, including hypersonics, space solutions, & more, which will result from this new relationship.

The Senate just passed the FY2020 #NDAA, which contains victories for Alabama & our men and women in uniform. This is an important step. Looking forward to securing funding for @DeptofDefense through the appropriations process as soon as possible. https://t.co/dsFMHYLaAj

In the wake of the devastating storms that passed through Alabama yesterday, my prayers remain with the families of those who lost their lives and those who were injured. For those impacted and still in need of assistance, please visit @AlabamaEMA: https://t.co/pWPxvlbMMA

Big news for Jack Edwards National Airport in #BaldwinCounty! The airport is now eligible for funding as a part of the @FAANews Contract Tower Program. This has the ability to boost the economy of Alabama’s Gulf Coast for years to come.
